label: 知行国
本: Court and Bakufu in Japan:  Essays in Kamakura History . Stanford University Press . 1982
説明文: A province held in proprietorship" by a ranking Court noble or religious institution during Heian and Kamakura times. Provincial proprietors (chigyōkokushu) enjoyed the right to nominate governors, as well as the right to receive income from the cultivated "public lands" (kokugaryō).　[[知行国主、国衙領]　"
